intro: Calibrachoa pubescens, commonly known as the hairy calibrachoa, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its small, vibrant flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant has hairy leaves and stems, which give it its common name. It thrives in warm, sunny conditions and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Calibrachoa pubescens is known for its compact growth habit and ability to bloom profusely throughout the growing season.
